entities.description: Violations related to gambling equipment.
Tampering with sports in an illegal manner.
Engaging in sexual activities for commercial purposes.
Helping or promoting prostitution.
Buying services of a prostitute.
Offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting something of value to influence an action.
Violations of laws governing weapons and firearms.
Engaging in commercial sex acts through human trafficking.
Killing a human being intentionally and without negligence.
Killing another person through recklessness or negligence.
Homicide without criminal intent, often in self-defense.
Taking away or detaining a person against their will.
Sexual assault involving sexual intercourse without consent.
Sexual acts defined as crimes under law.
Sexual assault involving the use of an object.
Indecent liberties or child molesting acts.
Taking property from a person or place by force or threat.
An attack causing serious bodily injury.
An attack causing minor injury or offensive physical contact.
Threatening behavior that makes another person fearful.
The criminal act of setting fire to property.
Obtaining something through force or threats.
Illegal entry into a building with intent to commit a crime.
Stealing from someone's pockets or clothing.

relationships.description: Substance abuse often intersects with activities such as prostitution.
Economic hardship can result in violations of weapon laws.
Intimidation can be a behavior associated with certain mental health issues.
Economic downturn in rural areas can lead to increases in bribery.
Lack of education can contribute to higher crime rates, including arson and robbery.
Substance abuse can worsen existing mental health issues.
Drug trafficking operations can facilitate human trafficking for commercial sex acts.
